div.div:
fix: Also fix the same Youtube iframe issue in button preview.
Signed-off-by: 陳鈞 <jim60105@gmail.com>
Closed #24 The `start` parameter of the Youtube iframe does not working, it will force a jump back to the user's last viewing position.

fix: Youtube iframe will force a jump back to the user's last viewing position.
Close #24
Signed-off-by: 陳鈞 <jim60105@gmail.com>
Commented on #24 預覽會跳回最後觀看處

This is a translation for newcomers, the content is the same as the previous comment which wrote in Chinese. The problem lies in YouTube's memory of the user's last viewing history and its attempt to start playing from the last viewed position. This conflicts with the purpose of the start parameter in iframes, and I believe it is a bug on YouTube's side. From the perspective of sound-buttons, the solution is to block iframe access to cookies so that there won't be any issues without user information. Note: https://stackoverflow.com/a/59292044 `` When using only sandbox="allow-scripts" , it also blocks iframe access to document.caches , causing YouTube to malfunction directly. It needs to be added with sandbox="allow-scripts allow-same-origin" . However, allow-same-origin also allows it to use cookies, so this method cannot solve our issue. The solution is to use credentialless on iframes.
This will made this iframe excute in a separate new context. It can access what was mentioned above but within a new context, similar to using an incognito window (strictly speaking not exactly the same, but you can understand it simply like that). Please note that this feature has limited cross-browser support. You can test whether your environment supports it on this webpage: https://iframe-credentialless.glitch.me/ There are two exceptions:
Brave browser does not support iframe credentialless in actual testing. Brave users has to enable Shields on YouTube and setup to block third-party cookies.
Safari does not support iframe credentialless. However, Safari blocks all third-party cookies, so there is no problem in our usage scenario.
Note that Chrome plans to phase out third-party cookies by 2024 Q3.
Commented on #24 預覽會跳回最後觀看處

問題是出在 Youtube 會記憶使用者上次的觀看記錄，並試圖從上次的觀看位置開始播放。這跟 iframe 的 start 參數用途衝突，我認為是一個 (Youtube方面的) bug。 從 sound-buttons 的角度來說，解決方案是阻擋 iframe 存取 cookies，沒有用戶資訊就不會有被記錄的問題。 筆記 https://stackoverflow.com/a/59292044 `` 僅使用 sandbox="allow-scripts" 時同時會阻擋 iframe 存取 document.caches 導致Youtube直接罷工，需加上 sandbox="allow-scripts allow-same-origin" 。而 allow-same-origin 也會允許它使用 cookies，所以這個方法無法解決問題。 解決方案是在 iframe 上使用 credentialless
這會使這個 iframe 被開啟在一個獨立的新的執行環境。它可以訪問前述需要的東西，但是是在一個新的環境，就像是使用無痕視窗(嚴格來說並不相同，但你可以簡單的如此理解)。 需要注意的是它的支援性並不完整。在此網頁上可以測試自己的環境是否支援: https://iframe-credentialless.glitch.me/ 有兩特例:
Brave 瀏覧器實測並不支援 iframe credentialless。Brave 用戶請在 Youtube 頁面上啟用 Shields 並設定阻擋第三方 cookies。
Safari 不支援 iframe credentialless。但是 Safari 阻擋所有的第三方 cookies，所以在我的使用情境中並沒有問題。
附註，Chrome預計於 2024 Q3 全面停用第三方 cookies。
